background.simple: Divorce case origins and tax return issues.
background.detailed: The case stems from issues arising from a petition to modify in a separate divorce proceeding. It involves tax returns, tax exemptions, and the roles of various parties in preparing and filing amended tax returns.

evidence.detailed: Pro Forma Returns prepared by HRB

legalArgument.detailed: Kirkham raised claims for tortious conversion
Violation of the Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act

initialJudgment.detailed: The trial court authorized Widdison to claim the child exemption for tax years 2009 through 2012
Ordered Kirkham to sign and file the Amended Returns

appeal.detailed: Kirkham appealed the trial court's decisions

outcome.detailed: The Court of Appeals of Utah affirmed the trial court's decisions

otherInfo.detailed: Parties involved include Janae A. Kirkham (Appellant), Jamie Widdison, HRB Tax Group, Grace Hansen, Bonny Widdison, and Alpine Gardens Inc. (Appellees)
The case has been appealed multiple times, with this being the fourth appeal by Kirkham
